comment: A mapping (first hypothesis) that is one-to-one (second hypothesis) implies its domain is dominated by its codomain. ` C ` and ` D ` can be read ` C ( x ) ` and ` D ( y ) ` , as can be inferred from their distinct variable conditions. (Contributed by NM, 26-Oct-2003.)
